description:
Walküre and Delta Flight used music to save people from the Vár Syndrome, a previously unknown disease that made humans and others go berserk. However, they find themselves facing a new threat…

(Source: Anime News Network)

node.description:
Shouji Kawamori is an anime creator, director and mechanical designer. Also a current advisor for [Satelight](https://anilist.co/studio/41/).

Famous for his work in the [Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/) and Transformers franchises. He pioneered several innovative concepts in his works, such as transforming mecha (including the VF-1 Valkyrie in Macross and Optimus Prime in Transformers) and virtual idols (including Lynn Minmay and Sharon Apple in the Macross franchise).

Kawamori attended Keio University together with Macross screenwriter [Hiroshi Oonogi](https://anilist.co/staff/97701/) and character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/). There they became friends and founded a [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/) fan club called "Gunsight One," a name the group would use years later during the development of the fictional world of the Macross series. Later on his career Kawamori created or co-created the concepts which served as basis for several anime series. His projects are usually noted to contain strong themes of love, war, spirituality or mysticism, and ecological concern.

Kawamori also helped to design various toys for the Takara toyline, Diaclone in the early '80s. Among them the first Optimus Prime toy design, Prowl, Bluestreak, Smokescreen, Ironhide, and Ratchet. Over 20 years later, he returned to Transformers by designing both the Hybrid Style Convoy and the Masterpiece version of Starscream for Takara.

Shouji Kawamori is an anime creator, director and mechanical designer. Also a current advisor for [Satelight](https://anilist.co/studio/41/).

Famous for his work in the [Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/) and Transformers franchises. He pioneered several innovative concepts in his works, such as transforming mecha (including the VF-1 Valkyrie in Macross and Optimus Prime in Transformers) and virtual idols (including Lynn Minmay and Sharon Apple in the Macross franchise).

Kawamori attended Keio University together with Macross screenwriter [Hiroshi Oonogi](https://anilist.co/staff/97701/) and character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/). There they became friends and founded a [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/) fan club called "Gunsight One," a name the group would use years later during the development of the fictional world of the Macross series. Later on his career Kawamori created or co-created the concepts which served as basis for several anime series. His projects are usually noted to contain strong themes of love, war, spirituality or mysticism, and ecological concern.

Kawamori also helped to design various toys for the Takara toyline, Diaclone in the early '80s. Among them the first Optimus Prime toy design, Prowl, Bluestreak, Smokescreen, Ironhide, and Ratchet. Over 20 years later, he returned to Transformers by designing both the Hybrid Style Convoy and the Masterpiece version of Starscream for Takara.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mitachisato?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor)

Chisato Mita is an illustrator and graphic designer for CAPCOM from Hokkaido. She had previous a working relationship with Satelight on CAPCOM's E.X. Troopers, and was recommended to work on character designers for Macross Δ. She has been a longtime fan of the Macross series, and desperately wanted to work for Shōji Kawamori. She went on to work on the character designs and outfits for Walküre.

[Website](https://studio00132.wixsite.com/index/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/TENJIN_hidetaka) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tenjin_hidetaka/)

Hidetaka Tenjin is a Japanese mecha anime artist and sci-fi illustrator. After graduating from the Shibaura institute of Technology's Department of System Engineering, majoring in mechanical control systems, he became a freelance illustrator. He is currently the CEO of Studio Tenjin.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/331643934) | [Website](http://mazurka.moo.jp/)

While studying for a university degree in art, she was discovered by web artists [Shingo Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/114914/) and [Kenichi Kutsuna](https://anilist.co/staff/116007/), who recruited her to work on [Birdy Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/). She did not join any particular studio, but started her career as a freelancer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/SUZUKi_SAEKo?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor)

Saeko Suzuki is a Japanese singer, drummer and musical composer. She was part of the Japanese New Wave / Pop scene in the 1980s. She took a hiatus in her career when she wanted to focus on raising her child, but came back to work in the industry in 2004, working on projects like Sgt. Frog and many others.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miho_karasawa)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miho_karasawa/)__

Miho Karasawa is a Japanese singer who was previously signed to Horipro and is currently signed to Lantis.  Since 2014, she has performed under the stage name True (stylized as TRUE). 

She has performed theme songs for [Buddy Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/20533/), [Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/16524), [Maria the Virgin Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/20840) and [Sound! Euphonium](https://anilist.co/anime/20912/), among others. Karasawa made her debut in 2000 with the release of the song "Anytime, Anywhere".

[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4b1IVV9meynYx65WpsxjbT?si=WE-6Iq9OQFK9qKxcCRHYkw)

Walküre is a tactical sound unit featured in the Macross Δ series.

It also refers to the real life idol-group made up of the characters' voice actresses.

__Members:__
- [Minori Suzuki]( https://anilist.co/staff/120134/) (鈴木みのり) - Color: Red; 
- [JUNNA](https://anilist.co/staff/123119/) - Color: Purple
- [Kiyono Yasuno](https://anilist.co/staff/107711/) (安野希世乃) - Color: Yellow
- [Nao Touyama](https://anilist.co/staff/106184/) (東山奈央) - Color: Green
- [Nozomi Nishida](https://anilist.co/staff/120135/) (望見西田) - Color: Pink
Emi Nishida is a songwriter affiliated with Smile Company.

[Website](http://www.pyxie-llc.com/minakubota/) | [Blog](http://minakubota.blog8.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minakubota)

Mina is a composer and a pianist.
Tomisiro (stylized TOMISIRO) is a Japanese music production group consisting of Naoyuki Honzawa and Yoske Kakegawa.

[Website](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/suzuki-minori.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minoringo_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7f1T-CF50uNMmGK_I9cILQ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3Ath9xfI4WBdrZPFQ4VX9A?si=RqHEeCs9Sci2RtrWnmqvfQ) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/minoringo_official/)

She got picked out of 8000 people for the role of [Freyja Wion](https://anilist.co/character/90101/Freyja-Wion). She had no prior voice acting work.

Minori Suzuki is a member of the real-life idol group, [Walküre](https://anilist.co/staff/226500/Walkre)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.
